mapper.sql: a.id AS "id", a.proc_ins_id AS "procInsId", a.create_by AS "createBy.id", a.create_date AS "createDate", a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.del_flag AS "delFlag", a.testing_no AS "testingNo", a.line_no AS "lineNo", a.material_no AS "materialNo", a.sn_no AS "snNo", a.if_packing_good AS "ifPackingGood", a.if_outlook_good AS "ifOutlookGood", a.additional_instructions AS "additionalInstructions", a.new_remarks AS "newRemarks"
c.production_date AS "productionDate", c.status AS "status", c.machine_type AS "machineType", c.sn_version AS "snVersion",
LEFT JOIN tm_testing b ON b.id = a.testing_no inner join sm_sn_info c ON a.sn_no = c.sn_no
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO tm_testing_dtl( id, proc_ins_id, create_by, create_date, update_by, update_date, del_flag, testing_no, line_no, material_no, sn_no, if_packing_good, if_outlook_good, additional_instructions, new_remarks ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{procInsId}, #{createBy.id}, #{createDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{delFlag}, #{testingNo}, #{lineNo}, #{materialNo}, #{snNo}, #{ifPackingGood}, #{ifOutlookGood}, #{additionalInstructions}, #{newRemarks} )
mapper.update: UPDATE tm_testing_dtl SET proc_ins_id = #{procInsId}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, testing_no = #{testingNo}, line_no = #{lineNo}, material_no = #{materialNo}, sn_no = #{snNo}, if_packing_good = #{ifPackingGood}, if_outlook_good = #{ifOutlookGood}, additional_instructions = #{additionalInstructions}, new_remarks = #{newRemarks} WHERE id = #{id}
